verses.verse: “So you shall (Deut. 6:13; (Matt. 4:10)) serve the LORD your God, and (Deut. 28:5) He will bless your bread and your water. And (Ex. 15:26; Deut. 7:15) I will take sickness away from the midst of you.
(Deut. 7:14; 28:4; Mal. 3:11) No one shall suffer miscarriage or be barren in your land; I will (1 Chr. 23:1) fulfill the number of your days.

“I will send (Gen. 35:5; Ex. 15:16; Deut. 2:25; Josh. 2:9) My fear before you, I will (Deut. 7:23) cause confusion among all the people to whom you come, and will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
And (Deut. 7:20; Josh. 24:12) I will send hornets before you, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before you.
(Deut. 7:22) I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate and the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased, and you inherit the land.

And (Gen. 15:18; Deut. 1:7, 8; 11:24; 1 Kin. 4:21, 24) I will set your bounds from the Red Sea to the sea, Philistia, and from the desert to the River. For I will (Josh. 21:44) deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.
(Ex. 34:12, 15; Deut. 7:2) You shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.

They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against Me. For if you serve their gods, (Ex. 34:12; Deut. 12:30; Josh. 23:13; Judg. 2:3; 1 Sam. 18:21; Ps. 106:36) it will surely be a snare to you.”

Israel Affirms the Covenant Now He said to Moses, “Come up to the LORD, you and Aaron, (Ex. 6:23; 28:1; Lev. 10:1, 2) Nadab and Abihu, (Ex. 1:5; Num. 11:16) and seventy of the elders of Israel, and worship from afar.
And Moses alone shall come near the LORD, but they shall not come near; nor shall the people go up with him.”

So Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD and all the judgments. And all the people answered with one voice and said, (Ex. 19:8; 24:7; Deut. 5:27; (Gal. 3:19)) “All the words which the LORD has said we will do.”

And Moses (Ex. 17:14; 34:27; Deut. 31:9) wrote all the words of the LORD. And he rose early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain, and twelve (Gen. 28:18) pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
Then he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered (Ex. 18:12; 20:24) burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to the LORD.
And Moses (Ex. 29:16, 20; Heb. 9:18) took half the blood and put it in basins, and half the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
Then he (Ex. 24:4; Heb. 9:19) took the Book of the Covenant and read in the hearing of the people. And they said, “All that the LORD has said we will do, and be obedient.”

And Moses took the blood, sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is (Zech. 9:11; (Matt. 26:28; Mark 14:24; Luke 22:20; 1 Cor. 11:25; Heb. 9:19, 20; 13:20; 1 Pet. 1:2)) the blood of the covenant which the LORD has made with you according to all these words.”
On the Mountain with God Then Moses went up, also Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
